thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Wednesday, 02 May 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Qatar Airways would back any IAG-Norwegian takeover-CEO

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Qatar Airways would back any IAG-Norwegian takeover-CEO
text:
CARDIFF, Wales, May 2 (Reuters) - The chief executive of Qatar Airways said he would back British Airways-owner IAG in any of its expansion plan when asked about IAG’s possible takeover of Norwegian Air Shuttle.
Qatar Airways owns a 21 percent stake in IAG.
“Qatar Airways will always support IAG in anything they do because it is a business in which we have a strategic interest,” Qatar Airways Chief Executive Akbar al-Baker told reporters at a press conference.
“Whatever they do to expand their business it has been thought after well and we will support them.”
IAG, which also owns Iberia, Aer Lingus and Vueling, invested in Norwegian in April, picking up a 4.6 percent stake in the struggling carrier with a view to starting takeover discussions. (Reporting by Sarah Young, Editing by Paul Sandle)
